body:
1. If I create a guild as an experiment and it turns out badly, can I delete the guild or does it last forever like subreddits do?
2. Is there a way to display a guild that I moderate on top of the "MY GUILDS" list?
body_html:
1. If I create a guild as an experiment and it turns out badly, can I delete the guild or does it last forever like subreddits do?
  2. Is there a way to display a guild that I moderate on top of the "MY GUILDS" list?
title: Two Guild Questions

author.bio:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.
author.bio_html:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.

body:
1. No, it lasts forever. You can remove yourself as a guildmaster and the guild will become available for other users to seize.

2. There is a separate "guildmaster of" list below that.
body_html:
1. No, it lasts forever. You can remove yourself as a guildmaster and the guild will become available for other users to seize.

  2. There is a separate "guildmaster of" list below that.

guild.description:
This is where kicked content ends up. 

Content here may be yanked to other guilds.
guild.description_html:
This is where kicked content ends up.

Content here may be yanked to other guilds.
guild.name: general

body: I haven't heard of seizing before. How does it work? First come first served?

body: Yes, as long as you haven't done so in the past 30 days and are eligible to create a guild. It's automatic, so unlike reddit you don't have to wait for a response and it actually works for people besides powermods.
body_html: Yes, as long as you haven't done so in the past 30 days and are eligible to create a guild. It's automatic, so unlike reddit you don't have to wait for a response and it actually works for people besides powermods.
